result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorian A Thurmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs and surcharges by 05-24-17 or, if not paid, serve 20 days in HOC, consecutive to any sentence.

Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and ELDER CARE. Court does not object to ES. Can have maximum allowable hours for work and elder care. Court STAYED the commencement until 06-24-16

Letter Asking for Expungement.
for Cancellation or Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privelegs Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4), signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
CANCELLATION OF HUBER / WORK RELEASE / ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE PRIVILEGES PURSUANT TO WISCONSIN STATUTES SECTION 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Siefert, Br 47, for review.

Defendant Dorian A Thurmond in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve THREE MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work AND ELDER CARE.  Court does not object to ES.  Can have maximum allowable hours for work and elder care. Court stated the commencment until 6-24-16. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY  court costs and surcharges by 5-24-2017 or, if not paid, serve 20  days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE  to any sentence. PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Dorian A Thurmond in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  
Student Intern Carl Knepland under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  
Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dorian A Thurmond in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dorian A Thurmond in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-096

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Branch 47 for a Pretrial Conference.
